channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: It's the foundation of psychiatric diagnosis. And it's about to get a makeover
item.description: The current edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual is known as the DSM-5. What will the next version be called? That's one of several open questions as the "Bible of psychiatry" goes online.
item.content:encoded: The current edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual is known as the DSM-5. What will the next version be called? That's one of several open questions as the "Bible of psychiatry" goes online.
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: Rep. Ilhan Omar rushed on stage and sprayed with liquid at town hall event
item.description: Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar was speaking at a town hall event when she was rushed by a man who sprayed a liquid at her via a syringe.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar was speaking at a town hall event when she was rushed by a man who sprayed a liquid at her via a syringe.

(Image credit: OCTAVIO JONES/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Internal review contradicts White House narrative of Pretti's death
item.description: The preliminary assessment from Customs and Border Protection makes no mention of Alex Pretti attacking officers or threatening them with a weapon — as the administration first described the incident.
item.content:encoded:
The preliminary assessment from Customs and Border Protection makes no mention of Alex Pretti attacking officers or threatening them with a weapon — as the administration first described the incident.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: NTSB blames 'deep' systemic failures for deadly midair collision near Washington D.C.
item.description: After a yearlong investigation, the National Transportation Safety Board did not find a single cause for the deadly collision near Washington, D.C., but blamed the crash on multiple systemic failures.
item.content:encoded:
After a yearlong investigation, the National Transportation Safety Board did not find a single cause for the deadly collision near Washington, D.C., but blamed the crash on multiple systemic failures.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Bitter cold grips the eastern U.S. as storm deaths rise and power outages linger
item.description: Three Texas siblings who died in an icy pond are among several dozen deaths in U.S. states gripped by frigid cold. A massive storm dumped deep snow across more than 1,300 miles from Arkansas to New England.
item.content:encoded:
Three Texas siblings who died in an icy pond are among several dozen deaths in U.S. states gripped by frigid cold. A massive storm dumped deep snow across more than 1,300 miles from Arkansas to New England.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
item.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

(Image credit: Piero Cruciatti)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: 'KPop Demon Hunters' HUNTR/X conquer the charts and claim their destiny
item.description: The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.
item.content:encoded:
The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.

(Image credit: Lauren Crew for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.
item.content:encoded:
Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

(Image credit: Michael Probst)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A crackdown on immigration is leading to a sharp drop in U.S. population growth
item.description: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year.
item.content:encoded:
A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: 'Fireworks' wins Caldecott, Newbery is awarded to 'All the Blues in the Sky'
item.description: The best books for children and young adults were awarded the country's top honors by the American Library Association on Monday.
item.content:encoded: The best books for children and young adults were awarded the country's top honors by the American Library Association on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck
